children.subject: Hey, I haven't taken any of the courses but I spoke to a lot of professors about this (since I would like to take 189 in the spring too) and it seems that taking 126 before 189 is pretty important to fully understand it especially if you're shaky on probability from 70.

history.content:
If you haven't take a probability course, you must take at least one. Note that EE126 expects you to have taken either cs70 or stat134 first, so if you haven't taken any probability courses yet you might not want to take that one first. I personally have felt fine in Shewchuk's version of 189 with just cs70 and stat140 (stat134 equivalent), but other people are welcome to contradict me if they have different experiences. 

I have felt in 189 this semester that linear algebra intuition was more heavily stressed than I had realized. Math 54 + 110 is pretty good linear algebra prep, but my semesters of 54 + 110 did not stress SVD or Positive Semi Definite Matrices properties (which I feel are used a lot), so you may want to consider EE127. You can either take it before or if your schedule forces you to, you can read more about my experience taking 127 + 189 concurrently in @8968, @8893  (I also feel that 127 is a valuable course in its own right in addition to prepping so I highly recommend it). 

These experiences are just for Shewchuk's version of 189, I can't guarantee that they will apply for the fa19 profs. 

Also, these are my personal experiences (which may not apply to everyone), so other people are welcome to chime in if they feel differently than me.

I plan to take CS 189 in Spring 2020.

Which course should I take in the fall to prepare for this course in EE126, EE127, STAT134? 

Or a long scale, to prepare for the AI/ML courses.

I have already taken math 54 and Math 110.
history.subject: Course Suggestion
